intro: Myriotheca fraxinifolia, commonly known as the fraxinifolia myriotheca, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and the Mediterranean, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Myriotheca fraxinifolia is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
